intro: Arthropteris parallela, commonly known as the parallel fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Athyriaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that are divided into linear, parallel segments, giving it its common name. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters called sori. Arthropteris parallela is a perennial plant that plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
